data.title: Quick coffee and bagel stop
data.text: Located around the corner from my office I find this to be a great quick stop for morning coffee and bagel or bakery goods. Nice seating areas inside and out. Located in the lobby of the Wells Fargo building.

data.title: OK
data.text: Location deserves 5 stars but we found the food ok. Café is within walking distance to the museums. My husband and Father-in-Law ordered the breakfast platter. Eggs, sausage/bacon, hash brown casserole with toast. Eggs were more white color than yellow. Casserole was cold so neither of them ate much of their meals. More left than eaten. Coffee was just warm but staff was happy to heat in microwave. Mother-in Law had the wrap and she also found the eggs a bit strange. I had the French toast with a side of bacon and it was very good. I had hot chocolate and it was some of the best I've ever had. It was also just warm and I would have liked it to be hotter. We went around 10:30am so I would give them a second try for lunch. Total was around $35 for four adults. Beware of $20 parking ticket! We had never parked in that area and didn't see the meters. They are spaced out and hard to see.

data.title: The TEA, the BAGELS, all of it!!
data.text: It doesn't matter what you get.  It is all good.  Wraps, flats, salads, bagels, or cupcakes.  Freshness and high quality are second to none here.  The prices are a little bit higher and that is ok.  The tea is worth it.  Make sure you have time to read the whole menu if you've never been.  And yes, even though it is in the heart of downtown, kids still can eat here!!!

data.title: Quick lunch stop
data.text: Good for a quick lunch stop if you want to eat and run. Many locals seem to flock here for lunch hour from work (the cashiers were on first name basis with many customers). Order first, then wait for them to call out your order (no table menu or wait-staff); open seating. It was fine for us for a quick lunch on the go. Quick service, good cafe food. We'd come again.

data.title: Constant Customers
data.text: My family absolutely loves Cafe Carolina. We are huge fans of their salads & their chipotle chicken pani. Their pastries are great as well. They're most known for their cupcakes.

data.title: Average
data.text: Good enough food, but so many better choices around! Very much like a panera bread but at least it's local!

data.title: Great lunch choices.
data.text: We stopped in today for lunch. There was a bluegrass street festival going on outside and a Special Olympics rappelling event happening literally right on top of the Cafe (the Cafe is in the first floor of a 32 story building) and rappellers were coming down outside the windows. But service was super quick and the food was very good. We ate outside. Plenty of seating inside and out. Usually you can hear your name called from inside if you are waiting at a table outside. But with the clogging performance going on and the dj playing music for the rappellers they suggested we wait inside to hear our name called. Our group had wraps, paninis and soup. Everything was tasty. We will be back to support this business that supports the community.

data.title: Not Many Choices
data.text: The place does not have many choices. Just an average place. Worth a try if there is nothing else around.

data.title: great place for lunch
data.text: food was good and located in an awesome spot, lots of shopping. get to watch them make the meals if you would like

data.title: Great breakfast and lunch spot
data.text: This is the perfect central location for grabbing a quick breakfast or lunch on the go. They have terrific coffee, great quiche and breakfast wraps; they're famous for their blueberry crunch bagels and blue-iced vanilla cupcakes. Their flatbread pizzas, pressed sandwiches and salads are great for lunch. One caveat: this location is not open for dinner, so plan accordingly. When we're having a family day downtown, we always start or finish here so this is our breakfast or lunch. It's a nice walk from here to the museums.

data.title: Ok nothing special
data.text: I eat lunch here every two weeks or so mainly because they have the $5.99 special which includes a sandwich chips and drink.  While the cashiers are friendly the ones handing out the dishes that call out your name could seem a little friendlier.  I generally get the turkey sandwich which is pretty good.  However I heard they have recently just raised their prices to $6.99 for the special which I don't consider a real good value so I will only eat here less often.  The atmosphere is ok.  The bakery items they have don't look as good as most restaurants that have bakery items.

data.title: Enjoyed my meal and liked the location
data.text:
Eating solo is not enjoyable for me but I felt right at home having lunch and reading the paper at Cafe Carolina.  

The atmosphere was pleasant, the location convenient (outdoor seating too), food was average to a bit bove average (chicken salad sandwich) and I would certainly return and recommend this as a good reasonable choice while in the area.  Plus, from the continual line of folks coming and going and the line never ending, others must think so too!

data.title: The Sad Remnant Of A Very Good Restaurant
data.text:
Cafe Carolina started in the 1990s in the old Burger King space in Cameron Village Shopping Center. It quickly developed a following for its fresh and well made sandwiches and other lunch and dessert fare.
The restaurant expanded and at some point was purchased by Boddie-Noell, best know to North Carolinians as the owners of Hardee's restaurants (yuck). In terms of quality it's been downhill from there in my opinion. I work in the Wachovia Building and have watched this restaurant decline in terms of staff, quality of ingredients, selection, and value to the point where I now generally avoid it. Every time I've visited recently it appears some cost-cutting measure is in effect - elimination of menu items (the Italian Hero and Chicken Fiesta flatbread both eliminated) and replacement of ingredients (the replacement of the French baguette with a thick, stale-tasted sub roll stands out). When I've mentioned my dissatisfaction I am met with shrugs of either indifference or I-Don't-Speak-English. 
Thanks, Boddie-Noell, for taking a great concept and running it into the ground. You are as always true to form, producing overpriced bad food.

data.title: Nice place to talk, have...
data.text: Nice place to talk, have a lunch meeting.  Big comfy tables and outside seating.  Nice staff.

data.title: Excellent deli sandwiches, I love the panninis. Wonderful quiche, soups, and salads. Prepare to wait, there's always a...
data.text: Excellent deli sandwiches, I love the panninis. Wonderful quiche, soups, and salads. Prepare to wait, there's always a line at lunchtime.
